rationales.benevolence: She centers worker bonuses and livelihoods when weighing the roof-repair financing decision.
rationales.universalism: She connects her local constraints to global labor exploitation and systemic injustice.

rationales.security: She takes the loan to prevent worsening infrastructure damage and keep operations stable.
rationales.benevolence: She accepts personal stress and financial burden to protect the cooperative people relying on the facility.
She explicitly recognizes Roberto's family pressures and immediate needs.
rationales.universalism: She argues for watershed protection and downstream community welfare over short-term expansion.

rationales.benevolence: She prioritizes redirecting money to worker emergency support instead of costly certification.
rationales.universalism: She critiques performative ethics and defends substantive fair-wage and environmental commitments.

rationales.achievement: She tracks output, cost, quality, and payout timing to manage performance against operational goals.
rationales.benevolence: She focuses on converting gains into worker bonuses and family-level improvements.
rationales.universalism: She keeps broader exploitation across regions in view while assessing local progress.

rationales.security: She knowingly deprioritizes personal financial safety, despite concerns about low retirement savings.
rationales.benevolence: She chooses to stay because cooperative workers and their families depend on her.
rationales.universalism: She rejects higher-paying work tied to exploitative systems and stays committed to a justice mission.

rationales.security: She quantifies revenue and layoff risk and negotiates to keep the cooperative financially viable.
rationales.benevolence: She refuses to protect margins by cutting worker wages.
rationales.universalism: She insists on preserving environmental standards and critiques markets that reward unethical practices.
Finalizing a reforestation contract and starting planting is a concrete pro-environment action.

rationales.benevolence: She is emotionally invested in worker families and their day-to-day wellbeing.
rationales.universalism: She extends concern to refugees and climate-affected populations beyond her local circle.

rationales.achievement: She performs a detailed year-end review against concrete operational outcomes and targets.
rationales.benevolence: She prioritizes full employment and scholarships for children in cooperative families.
rationales.universalism: She emphasizes watershed restoration and broader social-change collaboration beyond immediate self-interest.

rationales.achievement: She advances a shared-facility plan with grant strategy, indicating goal-directed progress.
